content: We delivered consolidated first quarter revenue of $526 million, a 42% increase over last year's first quarter. During the first quarter, digital revenue runs 68% of the Americas and was up 99% in Europe, excluding movements in foreign exchange rates compared to the first quarter of last year. After adjusting for a $13 million impact from movements in foreign exchange rates, Europe and CCIBV revenue increased $81 million during the first quarter of 2022 compared to the same period of 2021. Americas revenue is expected to be between $340 million and $350 million, and Europe's revenue is expected to be between $300 million and $310 million, excluding movements in foreign exchange rates. I don't think it becomes -- I mean, even in the digital media, there's still a healthy direct business where things get locked in and positions get secured on longer-term contracts. So it's a little bit of a different answer depending on which part of the business that you're talking about I actually think visibility, where we sit right now, it's better than it was the last couple of years. And I think that was tested and we really went through that during COVID era, but I also agree that there's private landlords, there's municipal and casual municipal counterparties, given COVID, you're restricted from being able to do some of the things that generate revenue.
